intro: Cynoglossum clusii, commonly known as the blueweed or clustered mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and flowering display. Cynoglossum clusii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
